jurisdiction.title: School Curriculum and Standards Authority (Western Australia)

A17580662AE54B288F7DAFB5E9245465.description: Innovate on familiar texts through play

E6AD2D091FE249978B52552538B9AE9C.description: Retell familiar literary texts through performance, use of illustrations and images

22A301935D324540BCB1DFFE19A4387D.description: Replicate the rhythms and sound patterns in stories, rhymes, songs and poems from a range of cultures

C151358B5D1E412C80967F85B29E6172.description: Recognise some different types of literary texts and identify some characteristic features of literary texts, for example beginnings and endings of traditional texts and rhyme in poetry

3CB22FDCD9D349D18C3C1FF81A40F4AB.description: Identify some features of texts including events and characters and retell events from a text

B73E18855CAE4F4B8E3AB60E9AC3C6C7.description: Share feelings and thoughts about the events and characters in texts

52FCBDB818254A03AF01F888A2FA1789.description: Respond to texts, identifying favourite stories, authors and illustrators

3C8B83CBED1442C8A4D5EAEEC97CB48C.description: Recognise that texts are created by authors who tell stories and share experiences that may be similar or different to students' own experiences
